description:

specs repo requirement should be up to date with g-r
title: global requirement sync should be enable for specs repo

comments.content:
All OpenStack projects spec repo are using requirements and those are not automatically synced from global requirement.

specs repo requirement should be up to date with g-r
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ghanshyammann

comments.content:
This will be helpful to avoid any incompatible dependency in specs repo requirements.

1 case is-

pip 8 "Detected a distutils installed project" issue is hitting
for argparse for specs repo.

Actual issue should be fixed in pip but as workaround , making pbr version > 1.0 will works for spec repo.

pbr < 1.0 has pip explicitly in requirement.txt and trigger
pip to update to 8.
pbr > 1.0 does not have the requirement.txt thing and does not
trigger pip updates for venv.

Most of the specs repo has old pbr version and hitting this issue. To avoid such issue we should have spec repo requirement in sycn with g-r.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ghanshyammann

comments.content: Before making this we need to add check-requirements job running for those repo.

comments.content: There's no reason to sync the global requirements into the specs repos. We only worry about syncing requirements for projects that need to be co-installable for testing, and we do not install the specs.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~doug-hellmann

comments.content: Yea, manually  updating specs repo seems better approach. because of unnecessary addition of doc dependency in g-r.

    Sync requirements from global requirements
    
    spec repo has requirement which are not in sync with g-r.
    
    Incompatible dependency issue can occur due to old versions in
    requirements.txt
    
    One example is "Detected a distutils installed project" issue is hitting
    for argparse which can be fixed by Ib7e74912b36c1b5ccb514e31fac35efeff57378d
    -http://logs.openstack.org/34/269934/1/check/gate-qa-specs-docs/fc7a540/console.html
    
    But to avoid such issue in future its better to sync all requirements with g-r.
    
    This will be needed if check requirements job is going to be added for qa-specs.
    Related-Bug: #1536535
